psalm.text:
[[Ps 105,1]]Give thanks to the LORD, invoke his name; 
make known among the nations his deeds.
[[Ps 105,2]]Sing to him, sing his praise, 
proclaim all his wondrous deeds.

[[Ps 105,3]]Glory in his holy name; 
rejoice, O hearts that seek the LORD!
[[Ps 105,4]]Look to the LORD in his strength; 
seek to serve him constantly.

[[Ps 105,6]]You descendants of Abraham, his servants, 
sons of Jacob, his chosen ones!
[[Ps 105,7]]He, the LORD, is our God; 
throughout the earth his judgments prevail.

[[Ps 105,8]]He remembers forever his covenant 
which he made binding for a thousand generations.
[[Ps 105,9]]Which he entered into with Abraham 
and by his oath to Isaac.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 15,1]]The word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision: "Fear not, Abram! I am your shield; I will make your reward very great."
[[Gn 15,2]]But Abram said, "O Lord GOD, what good will your gifts be, if I keep on being childless and have as my heir the steward of my house, Eliezer?"
[[Gn 15,3]]Abram continued, "See, you have given me no offspring, and so one of my servants will be my heir."
[[Gn 15,4]]Then the word of the LORD came to him: "No, that one shall not be your heir; your own issue shall be your heir."
[[Gn 15,5]]He took him outside and said: "Look up at the sky and count the stars, if you can. Just so," he added, "shall your descendants be."
[[Gn 15,6]]Abram put his faith in the LORD, who credited it to him as an act of righteousness.
[[Gn 15,7]]He then said to him, "I am the LORD who brought you from Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land as a possession."
[[Gn 15,8]]"O Lord GOD," he asked, "How am I to know that I shall possess it?"
[[Gn 15,9]]He answered him, "Bring me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtle-dove, and a young pigeon."
[[Gn 15,10]]He brought him all these, split them in two, and placed each half opposite the other; but the birds he did not cut up.
[[Gn 15,11]]Birds of prey swooped down on the carcasses, but Abram stayed with them.
[[Gn 15,12]]As the sun was about to set, a trance fell upon Abram, and a deep, terrifying darkness enveloped him.
[[Gn 15,17]]When the sun had set and it was dark, there appeared a smoking brazier and a flaming torch, which passed between those pieces.
[[Gn 15,18]]It was on that occasion that the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying: "To your descendants I give this land, from the Wadi of Egypt to the Great River (the Euphrates)."

gospel.text:
[[Mt 7,15]]Jesus said to his disciples: "Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but underneath are ravenous wolves.
[[Mt 7,16]]By their fruits you will know them. Do people pick grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?
[[Mt 7,17]]Just so, every good tree bears good fruit, and a rotten tree bears bad fruit.
[[Mt 7,18]]A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a rotten tree bear good fruit.
[[Mt 7,19]]Every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
[[Mt 7,20]]So by their fruits you will know them."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
